### ENHANCED TRAVEL INCONVENIENCE

#### Section 40. Travel Cancellation due to COVID-19
We shall pay up to the Benefit Limit for loss of and/or forfeiture of deposits or charges paid in advance or contracted to be paid by You in the event of necessary and unavoidable cancellation of the whole Trip by You arising from:
i. You or Your Travel Companion are Diagnosed with COVID-19 and confirmed by a Registered Medical Practitioner; or
ii. Death or hospitalization of Your Immediate Family Member due to COVID-19;

The effective date of the above cover shall commence within thirty (30) days before the date of commencement of the scheduled Trip.

Once You cancel the Trip and a claim is made under Section 40 for Travel Cancellation due to COVID-19, the Policy will terminate immediately.

***N.B.*** *This Policy will only pay for a claim made under either Sections 40 or 41 for the same event but not for more than one of the Sections.*
questions: How does the policy define the time window for coverage under Section 40 for COVID-19 related travel cancellation, and what are the implications if cancellation occurs outside this period?
In what scenarios involving COVID-19 diagnosis or hospitalization does Section 40 provide coverage for trip cancellation, and what documentation is required to substantiate such claims?
How does the policy handle claims if both the insured traveler and their travel companion are diagnosed with COVID-19, and can claims be made for both under Section 40?

What are the conditions under which death or hospitalization of an Immediate Family Member due to COVID-19 triggers coverage for trip cancellation under Section 40, and how is Immediate Family Member defined in this context?
What is the maximum benefit limit payable under Section 40 for COVID-19 related trip cancellation, and how does this interact with other sections covering similar events?
How does the policy address the forfeiture of deposits or charges paid in advance when a trip is cancelled due to COVID-19, and what proof is required to claim these losses?
What happens to the policy coverage once a claim is made and accepted under Section 40 for COVID-19 related trip cancellation, and how does this termination affect any subsequent claims?
How does the policy ensure that claims are not duplicated under Sections 40 and 41 for the same COVID-19 related event, and what are the consequences if a claim is attempted under both sections?

Are there any exclusions or general policy conditions that override or limit the COVID-19 trip cancellation coverage provided in Section 40, especially regarding publicly known events or travel advisories?
How does the policy define 'necessary and unavoidable cancellation' due to COVID-19 under Section 40, and what criteria must be met to demonstrate this necessity?

If a traveler cancels their trip due to a COVID-19 diagnosis confirmed by a Registered Medical Practitioner but does not notify the insurer within a specified time, how does this affect claim eligibility under Section 40?
How does the policy treat cancellation claims under Section 40 if the COVID-19 diagnosis or hospitalization occurs after the trip has commenced or outside the 30-day pre-trip coverage window?
What documentation or proof is required to confirm the diagnosis of COVID-19 by a Registered Medical Practitioner for claims under Section 40, and how is this verified by the insurer?

In cases where the Immediate Family Member’s death or hospitalization due to COVID-19 leads to trip cancellation, what evidence must be provided, and how does this interact with any general exclusions?
How does the policy handle situations where the traveler or travel companion is asymptomatic but tests positive for COVID-19, in terms of eligibility for trip cancellation claims under Section 40?
What are the implications of the policy’s immediate termination upon claim acceptance under Section 40 for any other travel inconvenience or medical claims that might arise subsequently?
How does the policy define 'Travel Companion' for the purposes of COVID-19 related trip cancellation coverage, and what proof is required to establish this relationship?
If a traveler cancels due to COVID-19 related reasons covered under Section 40 but has already received partial refunds from the travel provider, how does this affect the claim amount payable?
How does the policy coordinate coverage limits and claim procedures between Section 40 and other sections that might cover trip postponement or curtailment due to COVID-19?
What are the policyholder’s obligations regarding notification and documentation submission timelines when making a claim under Section 40 for COVID-19 related trip cancellation?
